column4: Taza-  http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=4965956&postcount=9
My KERNEL PANIC is about mobo issues
- explain 'mobo issues'
As in apparently at least two dozen people with the same mobo and a similiar CPU have the same issue, but no solution as of yet.
Earliest of these are from 6.10
Latest stable.
This is happening on hardy?
Yes.
- Add anything you can to help here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.22/+bug/125925
Gah, know any better distro than Ubuntu with about the same learning curve?
- If you buy one from Dell or System76 you will have no issues
These ancient "medium importance" bugs which completely cripple my asus hardware are getting BORING
- You bought a system without researching hardware components, so now you deal with that choice, or just run windows
Actually, I just expected Ubuntu to WORK on relatively new hardware which isn't exotic in any way.
Y'know, like I've been used to with linux since, uh, 2003?
- I sympathize with you, I really do, and next time if you buy from a Linux system integrator it will be 0 fuss.  Until then, please add everything you can to the bug report.
I'll do it later on, now I'm just wanting to fix it.
To anything as detailed as launchpad it'll take a while. I guess it's Debian next.
We pull from Debian when we make a new release, it is highly unlikely it will work for Debian if Ubuntu failed
Seen it done (a lot of times) before. Ubuntu sometimes adds it's own exotic bugs.
- while briefly looking into it, it appears not just Ubuntu had the issue, so I would assume it probably exists in all distros at this point
And yet I've never had a compaq that failed. Irony.
Do you know if wildly abusive language is accepted in launchpad?
